    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Rverbio getInstance()
        Gets the rverb.io singleton, which is the primary interaction point the developer will have with the rverb.io SDK.
        Returns:
        Rverbio singleton instance.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context)
        Initializes the Rverbio singleton. The developer's interactions with rverb.io will be entirely via the singleton.

        Initialization must be done before the Rverbio singleton can be used.

        Parameters:
        context - Activity or Application Context

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                              io.rverb.feedback.RverbioOptions options)
        Initializes the Rverbio singleton, with options. The developer's interactions with rverb.io will be entirely via the singleton.

        Initialization must be done before the Rverbio singleton can be used.

        Parameters:
        context - Activity or Application Context
        options - RverbioOptions object to set defaults

      • getOptions

        public io.rverb.feedback.RverbioOptions getOptions()
        Gets the options object for this Rverbio instance. You can make changes to the default settings through this object. At this time, the only thing that can be set is "take screenshot".
        Returns:
        RverbioOptions for the current instance

      • addContextDataItem

        public void addContextDataItem(java.lang.String key,

      • getContextData

        public java.util.ArrayList<io.rverb.feedback.model.DataItem> getContextData()

      • sendFeedback

        public void sendFeedback(java.lang.String feedbackType,
                         java.lang.String feedbackText,
                         java.io.File screenshot)
        Sends the user's request to the developer.
        Parameters:
        feedbackType - The type of feedback submitted by the user.
        feedbackText - The text submitted by the end-user.
        screenshot - The screenshot of the app visible on the user's screen.

      • setUserInfo

        public void setUserInfo(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String emailAddress,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String userIdentifier)
        Updates the user's email address and userIdentifier. Both fields will be overwritten by the data provided, including empty strings. If you only want to update one field, use the appropriate update method.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The end-user's contact email address.
        userIdentifier - A string that the developer knows the user by; for instance, a useraccount number. This should never include private information like credit card numbers or phone numbers.
        See Also:
        setUserEmail(String), setUserIdentifier(String)

      • setUserEmail

        public void setUserEmail(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String emailAddress)
        Updates the user's email address.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The end-user's contact email address.
        See Also:
        setUserInfo(String, String), setUserIdentifier(String)

      • setUserIdentifier

        public void setUserIdentifier(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String userIdentifier)
        Updates the user's userIdentifier.
        Parameters:
        userIdentifier - A string that the developer knows the user by; for instance, a useraccount number. This should never include private information like credit card numbers or phone numbers.
        See Also:
        setUserInfo(String, String), setUserEmail(String)

      • startFeedbackActivity

        public void startFeedbackActivity(@NonNull
                                  android.content.Context context)
        Show the feedback activity
        Parameters:
        context - The context from which you are launching the Feedback Activity.
